channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-21768] JDBC: Strip the default union prefix for un-enclosed UNION queries
item.description:
beeline> select 1  union all select 2;

+----------+
| _u1._c0  |
+----------+
| 2        |
| 1        |
+----------+

The _u1 is superfluous and harmful to result schema parsing.
item.summary: JDBC: Strip the default union prefix for un-enclosed UNION queries

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: TODO: This needs a test with TestJdbcDriver2

-1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12969531 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

I have some concerns about this patch that I mentioned to gopalv, e.g., when table names start with _u, this would always remove the table qualifier. Not sure if this could lead to some other issues?

I am wondering what is the actual reason for the regression wrt previous versions and if we can solve it in another way.

Sure, I think that's a valid concern - we should switch it to the private prefix used elsewhere of "__" instead of a single one.

Not sure if this could lead to some other issues?

This is the result table schema and this does get stripped if you do "create temporary table foo as select 1 union all select 2".

And joins require explicit naming of union sub-queries, so this only applies to uncovered unions.
